subject: Olympic Games (2008)
lead_paragraph: Paul Hamm was in first place after the opening session of the Winter Cup Challenge on Thursday in Las Vegas, the first United States men’s meet this year on the road to Beijing, and his first full meet since he won the all-around gold medal at the Athens Olympics four years ago. Hamm, who took a two-and-a-half-year break from the sport after Athens, had 92.8 points, 3.8 better than second-place Raj Bhavsar. Hamm also outscored the last two national champions: Sasha Artemev (88.9) and David Durante (88.7). The finals are Saturday.
